name: Legendary American Indians Quiz | U.S.A. People | 10 Questions

questions.text: This great leader of the Seminoles was captured while under a flag of truce.
questions.explanation:
Osceola.

	He died shortly thereafter. Sitting Bull, of course, was famous for the Little Big Horn and George Custer.

questions.text: This Ottawa leader united the Indians against the British in pre-revolutionary America.
questions.explanation:
Pontiac.

	'Pontiac's War'. Crazy Horse was also at Little Big Horn against Custer.

questions.text: This great Cherokee provided a writing system for his people.
questions.explanation:
Sequoyah.

	A great contribution to his people. Geronimo was famous as a warrior.

questions.text: This Cheyenne leader was a victim of the Sand Creek Massacre.
questions.explanation:
Black Kettle.

	In one of the Old West's darker pages, many Indians were massacred by Col. Chivington and his troops. Cochise and Red Cloud were also great Indian leaders.

questions.text: Abraham Lincoln served in the military during the war against this Indian leader.
questions.explanation:
Black Hawk.

	Known as 'The Blackhawk War'. Joseph was the leader of the Nez Perce, famous for saying 'I will fight no more forever'.

questions.text: This great Shawnee leader was killed during the Battle of Thames during the War of 1812.
questions.explanation:
Tecumseh.

	He initially tried to unite the Indians and follow a peaceful path - but it didn't quite work out.

questions.text: This Indian Chief befriended the Pilgrims.
questions.explanation:
Masasoit.

	Thanksgiving, etc. Squanto also was a friend.

questions.text: This Chief was the leader of the Apaches before Cochise.
This Indian led a war in New England against the American colonists.
This Indian died during the massacre at Wounded Knee.
questions.explanation:
Bigfoot.

	Often considered to be the last stand for the Indian nation in North America. Another dark page in history.
